DOCNAME: CASE OF PAYKAR YEV HAGHTANAK LTD v. ARMENIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a private small - scale trading company which has its registered office in GPE .

As a result of this inspection , on DATE ORG ( ՀՀ պետական եկամուտների նախարարություն ) made an assessment , according to which the applicant company 's tax arrears amounted to QUANTITY ( ORG ) ( TIME . On an unspecified date , ORG ( Երևան քաղաքի դատախազություն ) and ORG of LOC of GPE ( PERSON տարածքային հարկային տեսչություն ) instituted proceedings against the applicant company , claiming that it had failed to meet its tax obligations in an appropriate and timely manner and seeking to recover the above tax arrears .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE ( Երևան քաղաքի Կենտրոն և Նորք-Մարաշ համայնքների առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) decided against the applicant company .

The applicant company also requested that payment of the court fee ( known as ORG fee ) be deferred . In his request , the manager of the applicant company submitted , inter alia , that the company was experiencing financial problems and that he was the company 's sole employee .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant company 's request for deferral and admitted the appeal .

CARDINAL . Following the reform of the court system introduced in GPE on DATE which brought about the establishment of ORG ( ՀՀ տնտեսական դատարան ) , the applicant company 's case was transferred to be examined by that court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to leave the authorities ' claim unexamined on the ground that the plaintiffs had failed to appear . In its decision , ORG levied a court fee on ORG in the amount of AMD CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( approx . FAC ) .
CARDINAL . It appears that the proceedings were resumed on an unspecified date .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided , at the prosecutor 's request , to take measures aimed at securing the claim , freezing the applicant company 's property and monetary assets in the amount of ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant company lodged a counterclaim with ORG , seeking to have the DATE assessment ruled unlawful . The applicant company requested that the payment of the court fee be deferred on the same grounds as before .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant company 's request for deferral of payment of the court fee and allowed the applicant company 's counterclaim , referring to LAW ( d ) and DATE ( c ) of the Law on State Fees ( « Պետական տուրքի մասին ORG օրենք ) .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG informed the applicant company that its cassation appeal would be examined on DATE . The letter also stated that the appeal would be returned unexamined should the applicant fail to pay the court fee by DATE .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) returned the applicant company 's cassation appeal on the ground that it had not paid the required court fee . The judgment of ORG came into force .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company applied to the Chairman of ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարանի նախագահ ) , requesting that its appeal be examined out of time and claiming that it was incapable of paying the court fee since the company had almost no assets and the existing ones were frozen .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG to ORG of ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարանի քաղաքացիական և տնտեսական գործերի պալատի ավագ խորհրդատու ) informed the applicant company that its cassation appeal had been returned since “ according to LAW [ ( ORG ) ( ՀՀ քաղաքացիական դատավարության օրենսգիրք ) ] commercial entities could not be exempted from payment of the ORG fee ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE enforcement proceedings were instituted and an injunction was placed on the applicant company 's assets in the amount equal to the judgment debt .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted bankruptcy proceedings in respect of the applicant company on the basis of an application lodged by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to stay those proceedings until a decision had been taken on the applicant company 's application lodged with ORG . It appears that the bankruptcy proceedings are currently still stayed .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the ORG read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . A ORG fee shall be paid for : ( CARDINAL ) lodging a claim ; ... ( CARDINAL ) lodging appeals and cassation appeals against court judgments and decisions ...

CARDINAL . The determination of the amount of a ORG fee , the exemption from its payment , the deferral or postponement of payment of a ORG fee , and the reduction of its amount are regulated by the “ PERSON on State Fees ” of GPE .
Private businessmen and commercial entities can not be exempted from payment of a ORG fee . ”

“ CARDINAL . The court , upon the request of a party or of its own motion , shall take measures to secure a claim , if the failure to take such measures may make impossible or hinder the enforcement of a judicial act or lead to the deterioration of the disputed property 's condition . It is allowed to secure a claim at any stage of the proceedings . ”
“ CARDINAL . Measures securing a claim are : ( CARDINAL ) placing an injunction on [ ( freezing ) ] the defendant 's property or monetary assets in the amount of the claim value ... ”

“ CARDINAL . An appeal shall be returned if : ... ( CARDINAL ) documents substantiating the payment of a ORG fee according to an established procedure and in a prescribed amount are not attached to the appeal , and , in cases where a deferral or postponement of payment of a ORG fee or a reduction of its amount are possible under the law , no relevant request has been made or such request has been refused . ”
“ A cassation appeal can be lodged on : ( CARDINAL ) points of law or a procedural violation of the parties ' rights ; [ and ] ( CARDINAL ) the ground of newly discovered circumstances .
“ CARDINAL . A document substantiating the payment of a ORG fee shall be attached to the [ cassation ] appeal . ”

“ CARDINAL . Judgments and decisions can be reviewed on the basis of new circumstances [ if ] ... a violation of a right ( rights ) guaranteed by an international convention to which GPE is a party has been found by a final judgment or decision of an international court ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Law on State Fees read as follows :
“ Rates of ORG fees shall be established in respect of the value of the property subject to assessment or the base fee established by this law . The amount of the base fee shall be ORG CARDINAL . ”

“ CARDINAL . for cassation appeals lodged against court judgments and decisions : ( a ) if a pecuniary claim – at the rate of MONEY of the claim value , but not CARDINAL times and not CARDINAL times the base fee ; ( b ) if a non - pecuniary claim DATE times the base fee ... ”

“ The following concessions can be fixed in respect of ORG fees : ( a ) exemption from payment of a ORG fee ; ( b ) reduction of the amount of a ORG fee : ( c ) reduction of the rate of a ORG fee ; ( d ) deferral of payment of a ORG fee ; and ( e ) exemption , reduction or deferral of payment of a surcharge imposed for the failure to pay a ORG fee to the budget in due time . ”
“ ... Private businessmen and commercial entities can not be exempted from payment of ORG fees prescribed by LAW ... ”

“ Concessions in respect of payment of a ORG fee by specific payers or groups of payers can be set by : ... ( c ) the courts or judges in specific cases referred to in DATE law taking into account the financial situation of the parties ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the PERSON on Taxes read as follows :

“ Tax liability shall include payment of taxes ( including taxes for a concealed or understated taxable object ) , and surcharges and fines prescribed by the tax legislation for violation of the tax legislation and other legal acts regulating tax relations in GPE . ”

“ Taxpayers ( enterprises , institutions and organisations ) and their officials as determined by the legislation of GPE shall be responsible for accurate calculation and timely payment of taxes , and for compliance with other requirements of the tax legislation ... ”
“ In case of delayed payment of tax , taxpayers ... shall pay a surcharge equal to MONEY of the overdue amount for DATE of delay . ”

“ In case of failure to keep accounts ( and also other calculations and ( or ) records envisaged by the tax legislation and the decrees of the Government of GPE ) or in case of keeping accounts in violation of the established procedure or inaccurately preparing accounting reports , calculations , tax returns and other documents and information required under the tax legislation , a fine shall be levied on the taxpayer equal to MONEY of the amount of the tax not paid or paid incompletely to the budget as a result of these violations . ”

“ In case of non - registration of objects of business activity , such as supplied , furnished , transported or sold goods and products , and non - registration of work carried out and services rendered in conformity with the procedure prescribed by the Government of GPE , a fine shall be levied on the taxpayer equal to MONEY of the overall value expressed in ( calculated at ) the sales prices of the unregistered objects of business activity , including the sold ( realised ) ones ...

If repeated non - registration of objects of business activity is recorded within DATE of the date when the violation was recorded by the tax inspectorate , a fine shall be imposed equal to MONEY of the overall value expressed in ( calculated at ) the sales prices of the unregistered objects of business activity , including the sold ( realised ) ones . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Law on Value Added Tax read as follows :

“ The amount of the concealed or understated ORG and a fine equal to MONEY of that amount shall be levied from taxpayers who conceal or understate the turnover subject to ORG and who conceal or understate the amount of GPE payable to the budget by understating ... the amount of ORG paid for goods and services in violation of the procedure prescribed by this law . ”
